comments:
I have the following setup
a plugin project which contains package net.enigmatec.rif.monitor.model
a corresponding tests plugin project which contains a package with the same 
name which contains JUnit tests. 

If I run this JUnit test within the eclipse workbench it works fine. If I run 
it with the EclipseTestRunner then I get the following error when the test 
tries to access a package private method in the plugin package class.

This occurs on both windows and linux. I assume it some vagary of the way the 
class loaders work in this environment.

try to access method 
net.enigmatec.rif.monitor.model.ProcessModel.addProcessInstance
(Lnet/enigmatec/rif/monitor/model/ProcessInstance;)V from class 
net.enigmatec.rif.monitor.model.ProcessModelTest 

java.lang.IllegalAccessError: try to access method 
net.enigmatec.rif.monitor.model.ProcessModel.addProcessInstance
(Lnet/enigmatec/rif/monitor/model/ProcessInstance;)V from class 
net.enigmatec.rif.monitor.model.ProcessModelTest
at 
net.enigmatec.rif.monitor.model.ProcessModelTest.testListenersInformedWhenProces
sInstanceAdded(Unknown Source)
at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39)
at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke
(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
at org.eclipse.test.EclipseTestRunner.run(EclipseTestRunner.java:364)
at org.eclipse.test.EclipseTestRunner.main(EclipseTestRunner.java:195)
at org.eclipse.test.CoreTestApplication.runTests(CoreTestApplication.java:35)
at org.eclipse.test.CoreTestApplication.run(CoreTestApplication.java:30)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.boot.InternalBootLoader.run
(InternalBootLoader.java:845)
at org.eclipse.core.boot.BootLoader.run(BootLoader.java:461)
at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39)
at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke
(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.basicRun(Main.java:291)
at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.run(Main.java:747)
at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:583)

I thought it was fixed in 3.0 M3 but I dreamt ;-)

Got the same issue, can be worked/around by playing
with the reflection in the test cases, but it is not
very fair !

Attached a zip with two sample dummy projects
bug.plugin (the plugin to test) and bug.tests,
which contains a mypackage.MyTestCase trying to access
a package method of mypackage.MyPlugin.

Fails with :
java.lang.IllegalAccessError: tried to access method mypackage.MyPlugin.
packageMethod()V from class mypackage.MyTestCase ...

Please see bug 42853 for futher information.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 42853 ***
